description: Simple, Powerful & Effective way to manage your delivery process.

blocks.name: createPickupTask
blocks.description: There are different types of tasks can be created inside Tookan depending on the workflow you have selected in your account for e.g. - pick & delivery task, appointment task etc.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: You can get a key from settings(Login>Menu>More>API Key) in your tookan account.

args.name: orderId
args.info: Your can pass this key as your own transaction number which can be used to identify tasks in tookan

args.name: jobDescription
args.info: The description of the task to be done

args.name: jobPickupPhone
args.info: The contact number of the person from whom the pickup should be collected

args.name: jobPickupName
args.info: The name of the person from whom the pickup should be collected

args.name: jobPickupEmail
args.info: The email of the person from whom the pickup should be collected

args.name: jobPickupAddress
args.info: The address from which the pickup should be collected

args.name: jobPickupLatitude
args.info: This is the latitiude of the pickup location

args.name: jobPickupLongitude
args.info: This is the longitutude of the pickup location

args.name: jobPickupDatetime
args.info: This is time before which the pickup should be collected

args.name: trackingLink
args.info: If this value is `1` it will return a url in the response where the driver's movement can be tracked.if not no url will be returned

args.name: timezone
args.info: Timezone difference with UTC in minutes for e.g., For PST:+480 (PDT: +420),For MST +420 (MDT:+360) for EST: +300(EDT:+240), for AEST: -600 (AEDT: -660), for IST: -330, for CST: +360 (CDT:+300)

args.name: pickupCustomFieldTemplate
args.info: This is the custom fields template name that is pre-defined in your workflow page in the admin account

args.name: pickupMetadata
args.info: This is array of object containing label and data where label defines the custom field name and data will be his value.(Provided label should be in specified template.)

args.name: teamId
args.info: This is the Unique id of every team. You can get it from the dashBoard. More>teams>respective id of the team will displayed.

args.name: autoAssignment
args.info: If this value is 1 The task will be auto assigned to the members of the specific team mentioned. or if this value is 0 it will be unassigned task created.

args.name: fleetId
args.info: This is unique agent id given to each agent, if given the task will be assigned to the respective agent. You can get it from dashboard Menu>More>agents.

args.name: pRefImages
args.info: This is an array of strings containing links of images.

args.name: notify
args.info: This is used to enable the notifications.

args.name: geofence
args.info: This is used to enable the geofencing.

args.name: tags
args.info: This is a string containing comma separated tags as filters for agents in auto assignment.

blocks.name: createDeliveryTask
blocks.description: This API is used to create a Delivery Task.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: You can get a key from settings(Login>Menu>More>API Key) in your tookan account.

args.name: orderId
args.info: Your can pass this key as your own transaction number which can be used to identify tasks in tookan

args.name: jobDescription
args.info: The description of the task to be done

args.name: jobPickupPhone
args.info: The contact number of the person from whom the pickup should be collected

args.name: customerEmail
args.info: This is email of the customer to whom the product should be delivered

args.name: customerUsername
args.info: This is the name of the customer to whom the product should be delivered

args.name: customerPhone
args.info: This is the contact number of the customer to whom the product should be delivered

args.name: customerAddress
args.info: This is the address of the customer to whom the product should be delivered

args.name: latitude
args.info: This is the latitiude of the pickup location if you have it. Otherwise leave it blank. We will get it through geocoding API

args.name: longitude
args.info: This is the latitiude of the pickup location if you have it. Otherwise leave it blank. We will get it through geocoding API

args.name: jobDeliveryDatetime
args.info: This is time before which the product should be delivered

args.name: trackingLink
args.info: If this value is `1` it will return a url in the respone where the driver's movement can be tracked.

args.name: timezone
args.info: Timezone difference with UTC in minutes for e.g., For PST:+480 (PDT: +420),For MST +420 (MDT:+360) for EST: +300(EDT:+240), for AEST: -600 (AEDT: -660), for IST: -330

args.name: metadata
args.info: This is array of object containing label and data where label defines the custom field name and data will be his value.(Provided label should be in specified template.)

args.name: teamId
args.info: This is the Unique id of every team. You can get it from the dashBoard. More>teams>respective id of the team will displayed.

args.name: autoAssignment
args.info: If this value is `1`. The task will be auto assigned to the members of the specific team mentioned. or if this value is `0` it will be unassigned task created.

args.name: fleetId
args.info: This is unique agent id given to each agent, if given the task will be assigned to the respective agent. You can get it from dashboard Menu>More>agents.

args.name: refImages
args.info: This is an array of strings containing links of images

args.name: notify
args.info: This is used to enable the notifications

args.name: geofence
args.info: This is used to enable the geofencing

args.name: tags
args.info: This is a string containing comma separated tags as filters for agents in auto assignment

blocks.name: updateTask
blocks.description: This api used to edit a task that has already been added.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: You can get a key from settings(Login>Menu>More>API Key) in your tookan account.

args.name: jobId
args.info: This is the unique id given to every job which is returned while creating a task

args.name: orderId
args.info: Your can pass this key as your own transaction number which can be used to identify tasks in tookan

args.name: hasPickup
args.info: Set `0` for delivery task or `1` for pickup task.

args.name: hasDelivery
args.info: Set `1` for delivery task or `0` for pickup task.

args.name: layoutType
args.info: For an appointment task this value is fixed to `1` else set to `0`.

args.name: jobDescription
args.info: The description of the task to be done

args.name: jobPickupPhone
args.info: The contact number of the person from whom the pickup should be collected

args.name: jobPickupName
args.info: The name of the person from whom the pickup should be collected

args.name: jobPickupEmail
args.info: The email of the person from whom the pickup should be collected

args.name: jobPickupAddress
args.info: The address from which the pickup should be collected

args.name: jobPickupLatitude
args.info: This is the latitiude of the pickup location

args.name: jobPickupLongitude
args.info: This is the longitutude of the pickup location

args.name: jobPickupDatetime
args.info: This is time before which the pickup should be collected

args.name: trackingLink
args.info: If this value is `1` it will return a url in the response where the driver's movement can be tracked.if not no url will be returned

args.name: timezone
args.info: Timezone difference with UTC in minutes for e.g., For PST:+480 (PDT: +420),For MST +420 (MDT:+360) for EST: +300(EDT:+240), for AEST: -600 (AEDT: -660), for IST: -330, for CST: +360 (CDT:+300)

args.info: If this value is 1 The task will be auto assigned to the members of the specific team mentioned. or if this value is 0 it will be unassigned task created.

args.info: This is unique agent id given to each agent, if given the task will be assigned to the respective agent. You can get it from dashboard Menu>More>agents.

args.info: This is an array of strings containing links of images.

args.info: This is used to enable the notifications.

args.info: This is used to enable the geofencing.

args.name: jobDeliveryDatetime

args.info: This is array of object containing label and data where label defines the custom field name and data will be his value.(Provided label should be in specified template.)

blocks.name: getTask
blocks.description: This api is used to get the details of the task.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: You can get a key from settings(Login>Menu>More>API Key) in your tookan account.

args.name: jobId
args.info: You can get it from task details.

args.name: userId
args.info: You can get it from account details page in Tookan dashboard.

blocks.name: getTaskFromOrderID
blocks.description: This api is used to get the details of the task.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: You can get a key from settings(Login>Menu>More>API Key) in your tookan account.

args.name: orderId
args.info: This will be set by you.

args.name: userId
args.info: You can get it from account details page in Tookan dashboard.

blocks.name: deleteTask
blocks.description: This API is used to Delete a task which is not necessary.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: You can get a key from settings(Login>Menu>More>API Key) in your tookan account.

args.name: jobId
args.info: You can get it from task details.

blocks.name: updateTaskStatus
blocks.description: This API is used to force update the status of a task.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: You can get a key from settings(Login>Menu>More>API Key) in your tookan account.

args.name: jobId
args.info: Single or comma separated values. You can get it from task details.

args.name: jobStatus
args.info: Refer status codes section above for various statuses available.

blocks.name: assignTask
blocks.description: This API is used to assign/reassign a unassigned/assigned task or an assigned task to Agent.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: You can get a key from settings(Login>Menu>More>API Key) in your tookan account.

args.name: jobId
args.info: You can get it from task details

args.name: fleetId
args.info: You can get it from your tookan account or you can use 'Get All Agents' API for retrieving list from your account.

args.name: teamId
args.info: You can get it from your tookan account in teams section.

blocks.name: getAllTasks
blocks.description: This API is used to get all the tasks as per the get all the tasks data as per the filters

args.name: apiKey
args.info: You can get a key from settings(Login>Menu>More>API Key) in your tookan account.

args.name: jobStatus
args.info: Filter the list of tasks via their status

args.name: jobType
args.info: Filter via Job Type - 0 for Pick Up, 1 for Delivery, 2 for Appointment and 3 for FOS

args.name: startDate
args.info: Start Date for the date range

args.name: endDate
args.info: End Date for the date range

args.name: customFields
args.info: You can pass this flag as 1, if you want the custom fields data to be included in the response. default is 0

args.name: isPagination
args.info: You can set this as 1 to enable pagination

args.name: requestedPage
args.info: Current(Which) page according to the page number of tasks in the filter

args.name: customerUsername
args.info: Filter the list based on the customer name.

args.name: customerPhone
args.info: Filter the list based on the customer phone number.

blocks.name: getAgents
blocks.description: This API is used to get all the Agents/drivers/fleets information with respect to a location. The response array contains a status key for each of the fleet, which shows the current status of the fleet - 0 for available, 1 for offline and 2 for busy, taking into account the location, connectivity, ON-Duty/OFF-Duty status and if they are presently working a task.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: You can get a key from settings(Login>Menu>More>API Key) in your tookan account.

args.name: teamId
args.info: Team ID

args.name: tags
args.info: You can pass the tags, comma separated, if you want to filter the list of agents via tags.

args.name: fleetId
args.info: You can pass on the `fleetId` to get the data of a single fleet.

args.name: latitude
args.info: You can pass lat long values to get the distance between agent location and this location pointed by the lat long values.

args.name: longitude
args.info: Both lat long values are required if you want distance measurement and/or enable geo-fence filtering of the agents.

args.name: geofence
args.info: This is used to enable the geofencing filter w.r.t to the lat long values

blocks.name: addAgent
blocks.description: This API is used to register a new Agent in your account.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: You can get a key from settings(Login>Menu>More>API Key) in your tookan account.

args.name: email
args.info: Email of your agent

args.name: phone
args.info: Add the phone number of the agent. He will get a notification with the links and credentials to download the app

args.name: transportType
args.info: Send 1 for Car, 2 for Motor Cycle, 3 for Bicycle, 4 for Scooter, 5 for Foot, 6 for Truck

args.name: transportDesc
args.info: Transport description.

args.name: license
args.info: License

args.name: color
args.info: Color

args.name: timezone
args.info: Timezone difference with UTC in minutes for e.g., For PST:+480 (PDT: +420),For MST +420 (MDT:+360) for EST: +300(EDT:+240), for AEST: -600 (AEDT: -660), for IST: -330, for CST: +360 (CDT:+300)

args.name: teamId
args.info: You need to pass a team of which the agent will be a part of. Team Ids are visible on the All teams page

args.name: password
args.info: You can set the password yourself, or leave it empty, in which case the system will auto-generate the password

args.name: username
args.info: Unique username, which the agent will use to login to the Tookan Agent App

args.name: firstName
args.info: This is the First name of the manager to be added.

args.name: lastName
args.info: This is the Last name of the manager to be added.

blocks.name: createTeam
blocks.description: This API is used to create a team

args.name: apiKey
args.info: You can get a key from settings(Login>Menu>More>API Key) in your tookan account.

args.name: teamName
args.info: This is the name of the team to be created.

args.name: batteryUsage
args.info: This is parameter decides the battery usage and accuracy level of agent's mobile.If '0' it is low,if '1' it is Medium, '2' It is High.

args.name: tags
args.info: This is tags that you can mention for any team.

blocks.name: getTeam
blocks.description: This API is used to get the all the team details along with their agents' data

args.name: apiKey
args.info: You can get a key from settings(Login>Menu>More>API Key) in your tookan account.

blocks.name: createManager
blocks.description: This API is used to Create a Manager.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: You can get a key from settings(Login>Menu>More>API Key) in your tookan account.

args.name: email
args.info: This is email of the manager to be added which is used while Login.

args.name: password
args.info: This is the password for the manager account to login.

args.name: firstName
args.info: This is the First name of the manager to be added.

args.name: lastName
args.info: This is the Last name of the manager to be added.

args.name: phone
args.info: This is the phone number of the manager to be added.

args.name: timezone
args.info: Timezone difference with UTC in minutes for e.g., For PST:+480 (PDT: +420),For MST +420 (MDT:+360) for EST: +300(EDT:+240), for AEST: -600 (AEDT: -660), for IST: -330, for CST: +360 (CDT:+300)

args.name: taskAccess
args.info: This is to give access for the unasigned tasks. Set this to '1' to give access and '0' not to give the access

args.name: addDriverAccess
args.info: This is to give access for the manager to create Agents. Set this to '1' to give access and '0' not to give the access

args.name: dispatcherTeams
args.info: Pass the team_ids in this parameter with comma seperated values to which the manager can access.

blocks.name: getCustomer
blocks.description: This API is used to get the all the Customer details.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: You can get a key from settings(Login>Menu>More>API Key) in your tookan account.

args.name: customerUsername
args.info: Filter the list based on the customer name

args.name: customerPhone
args.info: Filter the list based on the customer phone number

args.name: isPagination
args.info: You can set this as 1 to enable pagination

args.name: requestedPage
args.info: Current(Which) page according to the page number of tasks in the filter
